TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit DeleteFolderType extends ExchangeWebServices.BaseRequestType

Docs.summary: The class represents a request to delete folders from a mailbox.

remarks.para: Use the type to delete unmanaged folders and managed folders. You cannot delete default folders, such as the Inbox or Deleted Items folders, by using this operation.

example.para: The following code example shows the soft-deletion of two folders.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: The constructor initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property ExchangeWebServices::DisposalType DeleteType { ExchangeWebServices::DisposalType get(); void set(ExchangeWebServices::DisposalType value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets an enumeration that describes how folders are deleted. This property is required. This is a read/write property.

remarks.para: The following are the possible values for the enumeration:

MemberSignature.Value: public: property cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::BaseFolderIdType ^> ^ FolderIds { cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::BaseFolderIdType ^> ^ get(); void set(cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::BaseFolderIdType ^> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets a set of folder identifiers for folders to delete from a mailbox. This property gets or sets a set of objects. This property is required. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns a array that contains all the folders to create.
